_csv_file_doc:
A path to CSV file with localisations.
A CLI application requires this to be a valid path to existing file.
A GUI application can call PeakFit plugin from ImageJ and use this
path to say ImageJ where to store the PeakFit output.
The 'null' value is allowed only when loading from JSON to allow
the application ask user interactively.
_csv_format_doc:
A format of CSV file with localisations.
Supported values: 'PEAKFIT', 'THUNDERSTORM', 'PICASSO'.
_mla_type_doc:
A Micro-Lens Array lens arrangement.
Supported values: 'HEXAGONAL', 'SQUARE'.
_mla_lens_pitch_doc: A pitch along X direction (in microns).
_mla_optic_size_doc: A size of MLA optic (in microns).
_mla_centre_doc:
An X,Y coordinates of the array center (in lattice spacing units).
The MLA keeps the distance between lens centres equal to 1.
_mla_rotation_doc: A rotation of the MLA to match the orientation of the data (in degrees)
_mla_offset_doc: An X,Y offset of the MLA to match the orientation of the data (in microns).
_focal_length_mla_doc: A focal length of Micro-Lens Array (in mm).
_focal_length_obj_lens_doc: A focal length of the objective lens (in mm).
_focal_length_fourier_lens_doc: A focal length of the fourier lens (in mm).
_focal_length_tube_lens_doc: A focal length of the tube lens (in mm).
_num_aperture_doc: A numerical aperture of the objective.
_fit_params_aberration_doc: A fitting parameters for aberration correction purposes.
_fit_params_aberration_disparity_max_doc:
A limit of possible disparity between adjacent views,
from negative to positive value (in microns).
_fit_params_aberration_disparity_step_do: A step used for disparity range (in microns).
_fit_params_aberration_dist_search_doc: A window to accept points as belonging to a given Z (in microns).
_fit_params_aberration_angle_tolerance_d: A tolerance for selecting with angles around relative U,V (in degrees).
_fit_params_aberration_threshold_doc: A max. distance of the candidate (in microns).
_fit_params_aberration_min_views_doc: A min. number of views the candidate is seen to count it.
_fit_params_aberration_z_calib_doc: A calibration factor between optical and physical Z axis.
_aberration_params_axial_window_doc: A max. standard error in Z to apply correction (in microns).
_aberration_params_photon_threshold_doc: A min. number of photons to apply correction.
_aberration_params_min_views_doc: A min. number of views the candidate is seen to count it.
_fit_params_full_doc: A fitting parameters for full data set, used after aberration correction.
_fit_params_full_disparity_max_doc:
A limit of possible disparity between adjacent views,
from negative to positive value (in microns).
_fit_params_full_disparity_step_doc: A step used for disparity range (in microns).
_fit_params_full_dist_search_doc: A window to accept points as belonging to a given Z (in microns).
_fit_params_full_angle_tolerance_doc: A tolerance for selecting with angles around relative U,V (in degrees).
_fit_params_full_threshold_doc: A max. distance of the candidate (in microns).
_fit_params_full_min_views_doc: A min. number of views the candidate is seen to count it.
_fit_params_full_z_calib_doc: A calibration factor between optical and physical Z axis.
_save_dir_doc:
Save the results to a new sub-folder under this directory.
If set to 'null' or empty string, nothing is saved.
Defaults to current working directory.
_show_graphs_doc:
Show various graphs, a global switch.
In CLI app it pops up GUI windows, so e.g. on Linux an X server
or Wayland must be running and DISPLAY env. var. must be set.
_show_result_graphs_doc: Show only final three graphs with 3D view, histogram and errors.
_show_max_lateral_err_doc: In result graphs show only points with lateral error below this value.
_show_min_view_count_doc: In result graphs show only points with view count below this value.
_confirm_mla_alignment_doc:
Ask the user to confirm the data and MLA alignment.
This is only active with 'show_mla_alignment_graph'.
_log_timing_doc: Print timing messages to console for all lengthy operations.
